title: Is it good to re-post a blog post of some other person in my blog? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you technically see then this is not a good idea. But there are two ways you can publish someone's blog post on your website. First, you ask for their permission to publish their blog post and give them credit about it on your blog post such as this blog post originally appeared on xyz website. Second, you can write a curated blog post. In this you write a blog post about the add some lines and link that with the original post. If you will follow these then Google won't punish you. And also you will earn trust of that person who's blog post you will use.

No. Although Matt Cutts says that duplicate content won’t hurt you if it’s used correctly and isn’t spammy[1], most people who are new to blogging simply end up ranking against themselves in Google. In addition, all content on the Internet is copyright unless stated otherwise. In severe cases, you could have your website shut down or receive a legal usage bill for using someone else’s content without permission. Footnotes[1] Google's Matt Cutts: Duplicate Content Won't Hurt You, Unless It Is Spammy
